subject: Public Speaking
title: Ethos, Pathos, and Logos
description: One-minute skill: Ethos, Pathos, and Logos.

hook.text: Aristotle said every persuasive argument uses three tools: credibility, emotion, and logic. Ethos, pathos, logos.

buildup.text: Ethos is the speaker's character. Pathos is the audience's emotion. Logos is the argument's logic.

discovery.text: Most people lean on one mode. Great persuaders blend all three, shifting emphasis based on the audience.

twist.text: In practice, pathos usually wins. People decide emotionally first, then look for logical justification.

climax.text: The three modes aren't equal ‚Äî but the best speakers make them feel seamless, as if logic and feeling agree.

punchline.text: Convince the heart. Let the brain follow.

quiz.question: What does 'pathos' refer to in Aristotle's framework?
